snippet: Roman Polanski, a film director, wants to have the threat of extradition and jail time lifted, after fleeing the United States before sentencing on a charge of raping a 13-year-old girl in 1977.
abstract: Lawyer Alan M Dershowitz is asking permission to finish legal case against film director Roman Polanski, who fled United States before being sentenced on charge of raping 13-year-old girl in 1977; Polanski wants extradition threat and possible jail time dropped.

byline.original: By MICHAEL CIEPLY and JOANNA BERENDT

lead_paragraph: Roman Polanski, a film director, wants to have the threat of extradition and jail time lifted, after fleeing the United States before sentencing on a charge of raping a 13-year-old girl in 1977.

headline.main: Dershowitz Seeks to Bring Close to Polanski Case
headline.print_headline: Dershowitz Seeks to Bring Close to Polanski Case
